result.execSummary:
The defendant David B Hemmerich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250 fine plus costs. (fine/costs have been paid in full)

charges.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David B Hemmerich

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant David B Hemmerich in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Court allows defendnt to withdraw his previous plea, vacates previous conviction, sentence. State amends charge to Attempted Expose Genital to Child, 948.10(1)(a), gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to amended charge. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of amended charge. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.

Defendant David B Hemmerich in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews defendants motion for post conviction relief. Atty Reetz indicates matter is resolved, advises where matter is at. State in agreement with resolution, makes statement. Counsel request another date to finalize matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2017 at 08:00 am.
Subpoena, Certificate of Service & Invoice Atty James Foote
from Atty Reetz requesting hearing re: sex offender registry.
Motion hearing on August 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant David B Hemmerich in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews motion for postconviction relieft filed by Atty Reetz. Court reviews briefs filed by State/Defense, questions Atty Reetz on what defendant is asking for. Atty Reetz explains that length of sex offender registry is the issue, would like some time to look into a remedy to the issue. Court not going to schedule another hearing, will wait to hear from counsel if one is needed.

Defendant David B Hemmerich in court with attorney James Creviere Foote.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Defendant makes statement to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
for DNA Sample

Defendant David B Hemmerich in court with attorney James Creviere Foote.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. Atty Foote asks court to set off sentencing for 30-45 days. Bond remains in effect. Sentencing set for 3/18/16 at 9:30 am.

Defendant David B Hemmerich in court with attorney James Creviere Foote.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Foote indicates defendant had an evaluation with Dr. White, has gone over evaluation with defendant but ADA Korb hasn't seen report yet. Atty Foote would like time to discuss report with ADA Korb. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 11:45 am.
from Atty Foote requesting to reschedule 10/19/15 hearing to 11/06/15 when he'll be in court on another matter. Court reschedules.

from Atty Foote requesting adjournment of 8/24/15 hearing. Court reschedules.

State's Discovery Demand
No contact direct or indirect with juveniles. Can have supervised contact with is granddaughter.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant David B Hemmerich in court with attorney James Creviere Foote.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
